Creating a Change Request

Development teams create change requests to track the resolution of a problem or implementation of an enhancement. Many teams have adopted specific guidelines that govern the creation and content of change requests – for example, instructions about what can be entered in the Component and Category fields. Be sure to follow these guidelines, if they exist.

To create a change request:

  1. Select a folder from the application folder hierarchy.

  2. Select the Change Request tab on the upper pane. This action displays the Change Request list in the upper pane.

  3. Do one of the following:

    • Select New from the Change Request menu or context menu.

    • Click the New icon on the toolbar.

    The New Change Request dialog opens.

  4. Accept the default status New or select another status from the Status drop-down list box.

  5. Indicate the severity of the change request by selecting High, Medium, or Low from the Severity drop-down list box.

    6. Note: The team leader usually sets the criteria for high, medium and low status.

  6. If the change request needs immediate attention, select Yes from the Priority list box.

  7. To specify the type of change request, select Defect or Suggestion from the Type list box.

  8. Select the platform to which the change request applies from the Platform drop-down list box.

  9. (Optional) Use the External Reference text box if you are importing change requests from StarTeam 2.1 or 2.0 projects. This box might also be used to indicate which customer’s support call initiated entry of this defect. It can contain a maximum of 64 characters.

  10. (Optional) To indicate the build in which the change request occurs, select a build from the Last Build Tested drop-down list box. The default is the name of the most recent build.

  11. (Optional) To differentiate change requests (for example, between the component and the server), enter text in the Component text box. The text box can contain a maximum of 64 characters.

  12. (Optional) To group change requests by additional criteria, such as dialog name, menu, etc., enter these items in the Category text box. The text box can contain a maximum of 64 characters.

  13. Enter a summary of the change request in the Synopsis text box. The application can accept a maximum of 20K characters in this text box, but your database may accept fewer characters.

  14. Select the name of the team member responsible for correcting the change request from the Responsibility drop-down list box.

  15. Select the Description tab.

    1. Enter a full description of the change request, including the steps required to reproduce it, in the Description text box. The application can accept a maximum of 20K characters in this text box, but your database may accept fewer characters.

    2. (Optional) In the Test command text box, enter or browse for the path to a test for the change request.

  16. (Optional) Select the Solution tab, and enter a temporary solution in the Work around text box. The solution text box is usually completed by the user who fixes the code. In this box, the application can accept a maximum of 20K characters, but your database may accept fewer characters.

  17. (Optional) Select the Custom tab. If your company licensed Enterprise Advantage or Enterprise, your team leader may have created additional change request properties. (See the StarTeam Administrator’s Guide for information about creating custom fields.) To change the default property:

    1. Double-click the name of the custom property. The Edit Property dialog opens.

    2. Select a new value for the property. For integer, text, and real fields, Value is a text box. For enumerated types and user IDs, it is a list box. For dates and times, Value has a date check box and a time check box, each of which is followed by a date or time in the format for your locale.

    3. Repeat steps a and b for other custom properties.

  18. (Optional) Select the Attachments tab.

    1. Click Add if you want to attach a file to the change request. The Open dialog box opens.

    2. From the Open dialog, select the files to be attached.

    3. Click Open.

    4. Repeat steps a-c for additional attachments.

  19. (Optional) Select the Comment tab and enter any notes, such as the reason for changing the change request properties, in the Comment for new revision text box.

  20. Click OK to save the change request.
